text: Sugar's addictive and the more sugar
they add to our food the more we bias so
1915 the coca-cola company introduced
its first standardized bottle out of
Atlanta after they figured out how to
keep glass from exploding it was six and
a half ounces and if you consumed one of
those every day for a year that would be
worth about eight pounds of fat per year
by 1955 when sugar rationing was over
after World War two they introduced the
ten ounce bottle the first ones found in
vending machines in 1960 we got up to
the 12 ounce can but the single unit of
measure currently is the 20 ounce bottle
as it turns out there are two point five
eight ounce servings in that bottles no
one gets to point five eight ounce
servings out of that bottle that is a
single serving and of course we have the
7-eleven big case there's Buster a big
gulp whatever you want to call it 44
ounces if you drank one of those every
day that would be worth 57 pounds of fat
per year the question is what allowed
this to happen and the answer is two
things one sugar became cheap and sugar
is addictive and the more sugar they add
to our food the more we buy it and they
know it it's a business strategy
